properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 4 at 6:50PM MST until February 7 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Riverton WY
properties.description:
...Another round of snow will impact western and northern Wyoming
Wednesday evening through Friday...

.A series of weather systems will be moving into northwest Wyoming
Wednesday afternoon, producing another round of significant snow.
The snow will begin first in northwest Wyoming before spreading
across western and northern Wyoming. Moderate to possibly heavy
snow will continue through Friday, with the heaviest snowfall
Thursday afternoon and night.

* WHAT...Heavy snow with total snow accumulations of 8 to 12
inches possible.

* WHERE...Star Valley and Jackson Hole.

* WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through Friday morning.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible at times.
Commuters through Snake River Canyon and open areas north of
Jackson should be prepared for travel impacts.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING
